strings.Value: "Are you out of your mind? I can't let you go now!"
"I'm sorry, that was too harsh."
"I'm not talking about taking your freedom — but this stupid idea is going to endanger the lives of the entire party."
"If you keep acting like this — maybe I will."
"Octavia, you're acting like a spoiled child."
"Maybe you could explain what's going on first?"
"You'll let down me and the entire party."
"I understand. Will you need any supplies or gear?"
"Alone? Sounds dangerous. Tell me what this is about, and I'll help you."
"Have you thought this through? Alone, against the entire Technic League? Sounds like joke — and not a funny one."
"You don't have to do it alone. You have our whole team, plus all the resources of my {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}."
"So this was a test?"
"You know you can always rely on me."
"You act like a spoiled child."
{n}Octavia approaches, her face serious with hints of gloom.{/n} "Listen, {Name}... I have to tell you something. The thing is... I'm leaving. For a long time. Maybe for good."
"You won't let me, huh? Maybe you'll tie me down?"
{n}Hearing this, Octavia winces as if struck by a whip.{/n} "You know, I trusted you. Trusted that you're... Not like everyone else... Not like my former masters. I guess I was wrong."
{n}Octavia stares at you angrily for a long time, then looks away.{/n}
"Fine... It doesn't matter. Forget it. I'll stay... For now."
"You would be fine!"
"Are you... Serious? Are you really ready to just let me go?"

"I'm going to {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} to destroy the {g|Technic League}Technic League{/g}. You have no idea what monsters they are. They kill people, enslave them, conduct horrible experiments... I have to stop them!"
"I know. I'm sorry. But it's something I have to do!"
"No... I can't put you in harm's way. Besides, there are many things here that you must attend. Just wait for me, all right?"
"I'll go there and start a riot! I'll put an end to those wretches once and for all!"
{n}Octavia keeps looking into your eyes, then finally looks away.{/n} "You're right. It's a stupid idea... I think I mixed up my dreams and reality for a moment."
"Are you... Serious? Are you really prepared to start a war with {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} for me?"
"In the name of {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g}... That's why I love you. How could I have thought you'd have a different answer?"
"Yes... Probably..."
"Yes, I know. Thank you. And..."
"A test? Well... Not exactly, but..."
{n}The end of the sentence hangs in the air, as if Octavia wanted to apologize, but couldn't find the words.{/n}
